SENT.plain: The range of the Djungarian hamster cell lines selected for colchicine resistance in high doses (from 7 to 200 micrograms/ml) was studied
These cell lines are characterized by the different levels of drug-resistance (1000- to 16000-fold)
A positive correlation is found between the reversion rate of malignant phenotype and the cellular drug-resistance level
Tumorigenicity and anchorage independence decrease with an increase of the drug-resistance level
The actin-containing bundles of microfilaments in more resistant cells are more organized
The 22 kD protein content increases with the drug-resistance level
The mechanisms of malignancy reversion are discussed
